00052 
00054   class MatrixReadError : public std::runtime_error {
00055   public:
00056     explicit MatrixReadError(const std::string& msg) : runtime_error(msg) { }
00057   };
00058 
00059   // Forward declaration for reading implementations...
00060   template<class T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00061   struct MatrixReadImpl;
00062 
00063 
00064 
00065   // The following are the templated global functions.  Do not
00066   // overload/specialize them.  Instead, specialize the
00067   // MatrixReadImpl class...
00068 
00069 
00071   template<class T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00072   Math::Matrix<T,P,S> readAsciiMatrix(std::istream& is) {
00073     return(MatrixReadImpl<T,P,S>::read(is));
00074   }
00075 
00077   template<class T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00078   void readAsciiMatrix(std::istream& is, Math::Matrix<T,P,S>& M) {
00079     M = MatrixReadImpl<T,P,S>::read(is);
00080   }
00081 
00083   template<class T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00084   Math::Matrix<T,P,S> readAsciiMatrix(const std::string& fname) {
00085     std::ifstream ifs(fname.c_str());
00086     if (!ifs)
00087       throw(MatrixReadError("Cannot open " + fname + " for reading."));
00088     return(MatrixReadImpl<T,P,S>::read(ifs));
00089   }
00090 
00092   template<class T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00093   void readAsciiMatrix(const std::string& fname, Math::Matrix<T,P,S>& M) {
00094     std::ifstream ifs(fname.c_str());
00095     if (!ifs)
00096       throw(MatrixReadError("Cannot open " + fname + " for reading."));
00097     M = MatrixReadImpl<T,P,S>::read(ifs);
00098   }

00100   // Implementations and specializations...
00101 
00102   template<class T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00103   struct MatrixReadImpl {
00104     static Math::Matrix<T,P,S> read(std::istream& is) {
00105       std::string inbuf;
00106       int m = 0, n = 0;
00107 
00108       // First, search for the marker...
00109       int k = 0;
00110       while (getline(is, inbuf).good()) {
00111         ++k;
00112         int i = sscanf(inbuf.c_str(), "# %d %d", &m, &n);
00113         if (i == 2)
00114           break;
00115       }
00116       if (m == 0 && n == 0)
00117         throw(MatrixReadError("Could not find magic marker in matrix file"));
00118       if (m == 0 || n == 0)
00119         throw(MatrixReadError("Error while reading magic marker"));
00120 
00121 
00122       T datum;
00123       Math::Matrix<T,P,S> R(m, n);
00124       for (int j=0;j < m; ++j) {
00125         for (int i=0; i<n; ++i) {
00126           if (!(is >> inbuf)) {
00127             std::stringstream s;
00128             s << "Read error at (" << j << "," << i << ") with input '" << inbuf << "'";
00129             throw(MatrixReadError(s.str()));
00130           }
00131           std::istringstream iss(inbuf);
00132           if (!(iss >> datum)) {
00133             std::stringstream s;
00134             s << "Invalid conversion on matrix read at (" << j << "," << i << ") of '" << inbuf << "'";
00135             throw(MatrixReadError(s.str()));
00136           }
00137           R(j, i) = datum;
00138         }
00139       }
00140 
00141       return(R);
00142     }
00143   };
00144 
00146   template<class T, class P>
00147   struct MatrixReadImpl<T,P,Math::SparseArray> {
00148     static Math::Matrix<T,P, Math::SparseArray> read(std::istream& is) {
00149       std::string inbuf;
00150       uint m = 0, n = 0;
00151       ulong l = 0;
00152 
00153       // First, search for the marker...
00154       while (getline(is, inbuf).good()) {
00155         char buf[20];
00156         int i = sscanf(inbuf.c_str(), "# %lu %u %u %10s", &l, &m, &n, buf);
00157         if (i != 4)
00158           continue;
00159         if (strncmp(buf, "SPARSE", 6) == 0)
00160           break;
00161         throw(MatrixReadError("Magic matrix line found, but the matrix appears not to be sparse."));
00162       }
00163 
00164       if (m == 0)
00165         throw(MatrixReadError("Could not find magic matrix line"));
00166     
00167       Math::Matrix<T, P, Math::SparseArray> M(m, n);
00168       for (ulong i = 0; i<l; ++i) {
00169         ulong j;
00170         T datum;
00171 
00172         // Get the index
00173         if (!(is >> j)) {
00174           std::stringstream s;
00175           s << "Invalid conversion on matrix read at [" << i << "]";
00176           throw(MatrixReadError(s.str()));
00177         }
00178 
00179         // Get the value
00180         if (!(is >> datum)) {
00181           std::stringstream s;
00182           s << "Invalid conversion on matrix read at [" << i << "]";
00183           throw(MatrixReadError(s.str()));
00184         }
00185         M[j] = datum;
00186       }
00187 
00188       return(M);
00189     }
00190   };
00191 
00192 
00194   template<class T, template<typename> class S>
00195   struct MatrixReadImpl<T,Math::Triangular,S> {
00196     static Math::Matrix<T, Math::Triangular, S> read(std::istream& is) {
00197       std::string inbuf;
00198       int m = 0;
00199 
00200       // First, search for the marker...
00201       while (getline(is, inbuf).good()) {
00202         char buf[20];
00203         int i = sscanf(inbuf.c_str(), "# %d %10s", &m, buf);
00204         if (i != 2)
00205           continue;
00206         if (strncmp(buf, "TRIANGULAR", 10) == 0)
00207           break;
00208         throw(MatrixReadError("Magic matrix line found, but the matrix appears not to be triangular."));
00209       }
00210 
00211       if (m == 0)
00212         throw(MatrixReadError("Could not find magic matrix line"));
00213       int n = m;
00214 
00215       Math::Matrix<T, Math::Triangular,S> R(m, n);
00216       long s = R.size();
00217       T datum;
00218 
00219       for (long i=0; i<s; i++) {
00220         if (!(is >> datum)) {
00221           std::stringstream s;
00222           s << "Invalid conversion on matrix read at [" << i << "]";
00223           throw(MatrixReadError(s.str()));
00224         }
00225         R[i] = datum;
00226       }
00227 
00228       return(R);
00229     }
00230 
00231 
00232   };
